Next, one realizes the bliss of concentration, the concentration factors are in this order,
This is the fundamental concentration, well-focused on the mind,

Because the mind has bliss, it is still unable to bring about mindfulness,
Having realized the four meditative absorptions, all faults are completely eliminated.

Due to the prior good discrimination, it is the cause of the path of ascertainment.

Having experienced much suffering in the hells, fortunately obtaining a human body,

There are many kinds of lustful desires, following the different attachments that arise,
One contemplation can eliminate them all, namely the contemplation of white bones.
Form, touch, shape, coquettish manner, clothes and necklaces give rise to attachment,
What medicine can eliminate this? Nothing surpasses the contemplation of white bones.
First, at the big toe, with a focused mind, create a wound,
When it is broken and pus flows, the flesh all falls off.
Then contemplate the shape of the toe bone, like the color of a white dove,
As the wound gradually grows larger, the skin and flesh are all removed.
In this sequence, the flesh of the body is all removed,
With right mindfulness and superior understanding accomplished, one only contemplates the skeleton.
If there is any remaining flesh, it is called a distracted mind,
Let alone if one indulges the mind, like a monkey, running and seeking after various objects.
For many times, fix the mind, and know oneself able to abide well,
Next, gradually extend to other people, and generally contemplate them as skeletons.
Gradually expand to the edge of the ocean, filling it with white bones,
When this concentration is accomplished, abandon the vast and make it narrow.
When condensing, abandon from the outside, until only one's own body is a skeleton,
Still observe the tip of the toes, this is the sequence of concentrated mind.
Sometimes discard piece by piece, reaching the top of the skull,
One should know the last thought, gather and abide between the eyebrows.
If one practices like this, one will always be born in the supreme Brahma palace,
